abstracts.abstract:
Existing law requires a licensed general acute care hospital or acute psychiatric hospital to adopt policies and procedures regarding the responsibility for ensuring proper methods of repackaging and labeling of bulk cleaning agents, solvents, chemicals, and nondrug hazardous substances used throughout the hospital and does not require these health facilities to consult a pharmacist regarding the repackaging and labeling of these substances, except as specified.

This bill would make technical, nonsubstantive changes to these provisions.

actions.description: Introduced. To Com. on RLS. for assignment. To print.

extras.impact_clause: An act to amend Section 1250.06 of the Health and Safety Code, relating to health facilities.
